snippet: The government ordered three companies that received bailout money and have not paid it back — the American International Group, Ally Financial and General Motors — to cut executives’ pay.
abstract: Treasury Department orders heads of General Motors, Ally Financial and American International Group to take pay cuts, freezing their compensation at 2011 levels; all three companies have yet to repay bailout funds they received during the 2008 financial crisis, and their executives are subject to pay cuts as a result.
lead_paragraph: The government ordered three companies that received bailout money and have not paid it back — the American International Group, Ally Financial and General Motors — to cut executives’ pay.

headline.seo: G.M., A.I.G. and Ally Are Forced to Cut Executives’ Pay
headline.main: U.S. Orders Cuts in Pay at 3 Firms
headline.print_headline: U.S. Orders Cuts In Pay at 3 Firms
